basics.name: Kaysha Kealalio
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science-Security Science within the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. My anticipated graduation date is in the Spring of 2024.

work.summary: Provide technical diagnostic, triage, and advisement on cross-platform support issues.
highlights: Assist in the provisioning and troubleshooting of ITS supported computing for UH affiliates.
Provide technical advisement and support in the areas of hardware, software, networks, and cybersecurity tools.

volunteer.summary: Demonstrated commitment to public service by pledging to serve in a government agency or cybersecurity-related organization following the completion of studies.
highlights: Engaged in specialized coursework, seminars, workshops, and hands-on experiences curated to augment proficiency in cybersecurity concepts, tools, and practices.
Participate in an annual job fair held in January to broaden network connections with individuals in the cybersecurity field and potential employers.

volunteer.organization: NASA Lucy Student Pipeline Accelerator and Competency Enabler (Lâ€™SPACE) Academy
volunteer.summary: Facilitated the development of a comprehensive preliminary design report in collaboration with interdisciplinary teams specializing in science, engineering, and business for a space mission.
highlights: Oversaw and served as the project manager for a team of 13 college students located in various locations across the United States.
For 12-weeks, the academy offered distinctive and practical education into the ever-evolving realm of the space industry.

awards.title: TestOut Ethical Hacker Pro Certification
awards.summary: I earned this certification by successfully completing the scenario-based ethical hacking exam within the 2-hour timeframe.
